text:
Thomas,

I am reassigning this to you are you are going to be looking into memory leak
issues. If you follow the link in the comments and look at the different emails
Gavin sent, you'll see there is a lot of information on how to reproduce the
problems.

Vincent.
creator: vincent.hardy@sun.com

text:
setSVGDocument now works as desired.
It even supports null to clear rendering state.
creator: deweese@apache.org

text:
-->
I already set the SVGCanvas.setDocumentState(JSVGCanvas.ALWAYS_DYNAMIC);
on adding addGVTTreeRendererListener to JSVGCanvas

-->  
//then calling to this methoid for SVGCanvas

private JSVGCanvas getSVGCanvas(Document funnelDocument){
  if(jSVGCanvas == null)
     jSVGCanvas = new JSVGCanvas();
		
  //System.out.println("Inside getSVGCanvas where Document 
is  :"+documentToString(funnelDocument));

   //getting error here	, mentionerd below..
   jSVGCanvas.setDocument(funnelDocument);

   svgDoc = jSVGCanvas.getSVGDocument();		
   jSVGCanvas.setSVGDocument(svgDoc);  
   //logger.debug("Received Funnel Document :: "+documentToString
(funnelDocument));
   return jSVGCanvas;
}

The funnel Document String format is given below at end.

Now am getting error........
